journey.title: My Journey
journey.intro: With over a <1>decade of experience</1> in web development, I always loved design + code. But since I'm not as close as a Designer (look at the design of this website) I've become a <1>Front-End Developer</1>.
journey.body: <0>CSS and HTML</0> are my companions, but with <2>JavaScript</2> that the real passion flourished in my heart. Then came TypeScript, NodeJS, RESTful APIs and the Back-end Development was closer than ever. JS's frameworks and testing libraries started to pop out almost monthly which made the opportunity to create better and rich UI components (my joy), also we have stopped to use jQuery (right?).
journey.conclusion: One day I started to use Linux and the terminal and I became addicted to automate my workflow with Bash Scripts. With Docker and CI/CD knowledge, I could entitle myself as a <1>Full-stack Developer</1>, but I won't do that, and I'll call myself also as a <3>Product Infrastructure Developer</3> instead, which is way cooler.
journey.backend: Along the years, I've worked on projects with various different backend technologies: <0>NodeJS, Ruby on Rails, Phyton, PHP, Magento, Java... and more.</0>
